column1: Fastitocalon was a legendary sea monster
column2: apparently the last of the mighty Turtle-fish. He is only mentioned in Hobbits verse.

column1: Fastitocalon was the size of a small island and vegetation would often grow on his back when not submerged
column2: adding to his deceitful appearance as an actual island. Because of his huge size
column3: sailors landed on his back only to drown when he dove underwater.

column1: Fastitocalon derives from the word astitocalon of the Shire-speech (rendered in English)
column2: which itself is an alteration or corruption of the Elvish Aspido-chel≈çne (rendered in Greek
column3: meaning turtle with a round shield (of hide)). And "the F was put on by the versifier simply to make the name alliterate."; see also "Letter to Eileen Elgar (5 March 1964)" (letter)
